climbs.name: Tribute to Tara and Todds Liver

content.description: Follow easy hand crack (5.7) up through 5.9 roof.  Traverse face to left below horizontal flake to bolted anchor or continue up using crack corner system (5.8) to top.  Good gear.  Roof protects with a .75" cam below and a 1" cam above.  Use wall on right for feet to pull over roof.  Traverse can be protected using 2" cam placed above flake.
content.protection: Small rack to 3". New bolt anchor with hangers at top.  Can use first 2 bolts from adjacent route to protect ground fall.
content.location: Obvious crack through roof located between Out Reach Upmanship (named Duck's Breath in Laramie Range Guide) and Para Fin (named Postcards From the Edge in Laramie Range Guide). Start next to new bolted route The Pirate and the Chain Gang (FA Orenczak and Lynn May 31 2015).  Use these anchors for descent or top out following corner crack system.  Use new Laramie Range Guide Book for details on Duck's Breath and Postcards from the Edge.  FA of Tribute to Tara and Todds Liver on May 31, 2015 by Ryan Miller and Deke Doty.  Named in honor of the live liver donation of Tara Miller to Todd Pepper which saved his life.

climbs.name: Tiger Woods Me on Tiger Rock

content.description: Trample up this tiger skin looking rock over some easy slab and some bulges.
content.location: Find on the left side of some tiger skin looking marbled looking rock.

content.description: Follow this right facing dihederal to its end and proceed with the roof above.
content.location: Find this line on the central portion of the Meadow Mound.

content.description: Follow bolts up a nice golden granite prow just right of the black scooped face of Pervert. Engaging moves up side-pulls, edges, and underclings. Just when you think it's over there's a couple more technical face moves. Best of the bolted moderates here. The guidebook calls this "Exposure Therapy"
content.protection: Dozen or so bolts to anchors.
content.location: Start ten feet right of Revert to Pervert, under clean prow with bolts

content.description: Revert starts at a low angle but soon reverts to an angle that perverts have fun on but with big holds.
content.location: On the rightmost side of the black intrusion on the east side of the Meadow Mound.

content.description: Some steep, awkward crack at the start closes and the line continues through the overhanging holds and onto a sparsely bolted slab going rightward.
content.location: Near the left end of the black dike the intrudes the  granite of the Meadows Mound.

content.description: A steep arete climb leads to some steep face to the anchors.
content.location: Located on the west end of the meadow mound.

content.description: A low angle ramp of rock lead to a smooth looking vertical face of of rock with mostly horizontal cracks for hanging on.
content.protection: 5 bolts and supplementation as needed with gear.
content.location: The route lies on the west reddish face of the biggest fin of rock on the west end of the mound.

content.description: a stiff line with some neat positions
content.location: Find this route on the left most portion of the black rock intrusion on the east end of the Meadow Mound.

content.description: Several overhang alcoves give a standing tuck to find the best combination for exit out of a leaning out position.
content.location: Very close but left of the tiger stripped rock.

content.description: Link together a system of cracks to get up and right  on this central portion of the Meadows Mound.
content.location: A very obvious line in the central portion of the Meadow Mound.

content.description: A steep face climb with some hand hold emimination leads to easier going.
content.location: Starts to the left of the tiger colored rock outcrops.

content.description:
Called "Corn Dog" and rated 5.10 in the error-filled Laramie Range Guide (LRG), this is a challenging warm-up...

Moderate crack and face climbing protected by gear leads to the right edge of a large roof.  A heady move takes you to the top of a pillar where you clip the first bolt. Pull the roof via a short strenuous 10+/11- section.  Head up the arete and face to the base of the roof.

(NB Difficult 3rd clip unless you go past it to goods holds and clip it down and to your left.)  2 bolts out left force the climb through the steepest part of the roof to a desperate top out.  Or, to keep the climb in the mid 11 range, from the horizontal at the base of the roof climb out right for an easier exit.  Adding a bolt would create a better exit and protect good climbing straight up the face at the right edge of the roof about 10' right of the current bolted finish. No anchors.
content.protection: A few nuts (3-5 Rock size) and 1 set of cams to  BD gold. No top anchors.
content.location: Left of the 12a called "Duck's Breath" in LRG and right of an unknown moderate looking bolted route, climb a crack system to the right edge of a large roof and follow 5 sparsely placed bolts up and left. To descend, we down climbed to the anchors on the unknown bolt protected route left (west) of this route.

content.description: Mostly a slab climb on an arete face with small holds, some high steps and good pro.
content.location: On the white granite rib that sticks out from the black rock.
Find this low lying route on the west end of the Meadow Mound just below and immediately to the right of Out Reach Upmanship.

content.description: This roof route passes through a low roof, up some easy slab on onto some some steep horizontal and finihes with a friction traverse.
content.location: Find close  to the left side of the black rock intrusion.

climbs.name: A Lube Job on Tiger Rock

content.description: Climb some steep bulges on big hold and some slippery slab.
content.location: Route starts below a tiger stipped looking bouder near the right side of the tiger rock.

content.description: A low angle start that steeps near the finish.
content.location: On the black rock just to the right of the white fin  at the right side of the black dike intrusion.

pathTokens: Laramie Peak Wildlife Habitat Management Area
